definition: lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: I gotta go home and hit the books.
sentences.chinese: 我得回家用心啃书本去了。

sentences.english: It's no good talking to Tom; he's buried in his book again.
sentences.chinese: 和汤姆谈话没用，他又埋头啃书了。

sentences.english: Generally speaking, I usually stay at home, hitting the books.
sentences.chinese: 一般来说，我通常都待在家里啃书。

definition: variant of 復習|复习[fu4 xi2]
to study outside of class time (reviewing one's lessons)/to study in one's free time/individual study
to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
to read a book/to study/to attend school
to sit an entrance exam for a graduate program
diligent/industrious (in one's studies)/to study hard/to make great effort
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
